comments.commentBody: Damascus and Aleppo roughly have the same weather as inland California (think Bakersfield or Sacramento). Hot and dry in summer, cooler and wet in winter with beautiful springs and falls.

So much hysteria about the expiration of the Bush tax cuts on the wealthy! You'd think the top marginal tax rate was about to return to the rates in effect in the last age of economic prosperity, from 1965 until 1980, when the top marginal tax rate was 70%. If the Bush tax cuts are allowed to expire, the wealthiest individuals in the US will have their top marginal tax rate return to Clinton era rates, an increase on the most affluent of a mere 4.6%, that's it!

If one were to look at a history of top marginal tax rates, it would be clear that there's a positive correlation between high tax rates and national prosperity. Here's a chart that lists the top marginal tax rates since 1913. The middle class of this country started to shrink some 30 years ago. It's no coincidence that the top marginal tax rates have steadily declined over that same period.

http://www.taxpolicycenter.org...

Low maximum income tax rates for the wealthy and abundant corporate tax loopholes are something we can no longer afford. There will be no economic recovery without addressing this two pronged tax bonanza for corporations and the top 1% of earners.
If I can get $1 million bonus, I won't mind to pay 40% of it for our school.

Strange deal. Gaming the system to provide unemployment insurance payments to millions of Americans in exchange for perpetrating the illusion that the wealthiest need yet more wealth. Time must have a stop.
Or - just forget about morning news on CBS entirely. Bring back "Captain Kangaroo". Now there was a show worth watching.

It's as simple as the set.  NBC is bright without being annoying.  GMA is bright, but annoying.  CBS is dark and cluttered.  It's morning, we need help waking up.  Change the set, change the fortune of the show.
Not to be too harsh, but who actually watches these programs?  I don't get it.

The last time CBS lead the ratings from 8 to 9 am CAPTAIN KANGAROO was
broadcast.

I wonder why I am saddened and sickened. Maybe it's becauses my postman, who was just laid off, will have to go on unemployment until it's time to work at Dunkin'Donuts for minimum wage and no benefits. What a lovely Christmas for his family. Are those financial workers really so much more valuable than the average joe? And are their CEO's really more productive than say, our top research scientists? For God's sake, they certainly won't find a cure for cancer...not even for the common cold.

I think that I am going to be sick to my stomach.
This news article notes the following:
"Some compensation consultants have been helping their clients devise new labels for the pay that are less likely to inflame the public. For instance, some banks are considering reducing the amount of their payouts that are labeled as bonuses, and instead shifting some to other categories like “long-term incentives.”

In the last analysis, any nomenclature they care to devise is nothing more than euphuisms for the true terms of Greed and/or Greedy. Striving to "devise new labels that are less likely to inflame the public" is a fools errand. I wish them all lots of luck with this foolishness - insulting beyond belief.

This news article also notes the following:
"Currently the highest rate for taxable income is 35 percent; that would increase to 39.6 percent if the Bush tax cuts expire."
Surely these self-centered recipients of multi-million dollars in compensation/bonuses can tolerate a 4.6% rise in their taxes. Let them do so for the good of the country with its unmanageable deficit and its intolerable national debt.

Surely these Greedy ......... persons can step up and do something that might just possibly be called patriotism. We have 2 wars in progress, a declining infrastructure, overstretched military forces, millions of persons unemployed or underemployed, and all these miscreants can think about is whether to take their excessive (possibly ill-gotten) gains either this year or next year.
Disgust is somehow too mild a term to describe what must be the feelings of all the right-thinking persons in our society.

Where are the attitudes of these........ over-compensated parasites as relates to the Common Good and social and economic justice. These toads of finance and commerce are carbuncles upon the national body and should be excised/lanced as the disfiguring pimples that they happen to be.

Just exactly why have their values deteriorated to such a degree?? I have to say that I smell Fascism in the air.

Umm. Ok. So... isn't this tax evasion? I mean if I do something with my money specifically to avoid paying taxes on it.. isn't that... tax evasion? Gosh. I wish I could get a 960k bonus this year. That'd be great. Instead, I am on a wage freeze for the second year.
The Wall Street Banksters and fat cats are once again displaying their "patriotism."

They have nothing to worry about.

The puppet lawmakers will make sure their masters are taken care of by extending tax cuts even for the richest of Americans no matter how big the deficits get.

The rest of America can go to *ell.

It's not just the cost of basic cable-TV that sticks in our craw; the cost of HDTV via cable/satellite is even more -- and this is for on-air-broadcast stations! What's more, cable/satellite-TV providers require that subscribers purchase extra (and unwanted) "tiered" packages (sports, family, etc.) *before* they can add the all-important HD package.

Cable/satellite-TV is both a monopoly AND a "racket", and we consumers need to take a page from Nancy Regan, and "Just say 'No!'"

And that in any other universe is TAX EVASION. when will the time come when the people will finally say the filthy rich are liars, cheats and thieves and need to suffer like the rest os us for their greed, which is the cause of all the misery on the planet. Now if you are rich and this offends you do tell us what good your brethren billionaires bring to the human "human not non human" race.
Save even more on your taxes and write the bonus checks out to me.  I have plenty of room in my bracket.

Why is the democratic party capitulating it's not like we can afford these tax giveaways.  The repubs will shamelessly block every middle class initiative from here on out.  In exchange for billions in tax giveaways to wall street etc. Obama is willing to take a paltry extension in jobless aid? And this is at a time of 2 wars and failing state budgets,  this makes no sense at all.  I don't think the democratic party stands for me anymore, it's been captured by Obama and he's been captured by the republicans who have been captured by the plutocrats and he  is utterly ineffectual!

We are in our early 70's and still watch 60 Minutes at dinner.  Tonight's show featured Bernanke and Zuckerberg (not together). The interviewers didn't lay a glove on either of them. The Fed and Facebook got some free promotion.

Forget young people.  How about old people.  There is nothing on TV for us and we have the money and time to spend.  We've got Betty White and then nothing....  How about all those wonderful people that used to be on the Tonight Show...when Johnny Carson was running it? They had faces!  Or how about guest who aren't selling something.  Remember conversation?  That was before texting.  I'm just sayin'....old money!
You could always recruit Harrison Ford. Oops - that idea has already been Hollywoodized!

So they chose not to do something entirely prudent, something that would have enabled them to pay people less, before tax, had they accelerated the payouts, which would have left more capital in the bank (I bet nobody thought of that) - but of course they relented in the face of media bullying and political interference.  That is scary.

The sad truth is that television has not had a new idea in
years other than putting logos in one corner of the screen
and flipping constant promos in the other. It is all done by
formula and by ratings and there is not a shred of creativity
or imagination left. If CBS really wants to capture an audience
with its morning show it is time for something bold and new;
bringing in weekend anchors to replace the tired old team is like
putting a bandage on a major surgical incision. It won't do the
job.

Quote from post #1: "Seem as though cable news clobbers the once dominant networks"

Really? When did all cable news channels combined ever get 17.7 million viewers?

With all the money these Wall Street goons make, you'd think they could afford to hire better PR firms. But no.... yet another day of news revealing how messed up and penny-pinching the financial giants have become. $40,000 in extra taxes? What is that, half a day's pay for some of these guys? Cry me a river....

I wish this article had spent some time discussion the implications for revenue to the federal government of Wall Street bonuses.  Would the government have more money much sooner if they change their payout schedule, or do most of these employees manage to shelter a large portion of their income?  Where does all this bonus money go?  What would the 4.5% difference in the highest tax bracket mean for the federal government's share of the Wall Street bonus packages?
